lines.text:
[pointing the gun at her son]
Go ahead! Make your bed.
His ass was the grass and I was the lawnmower.

[singing softly and contentedly as she sloshes and scrubs Joe's prized .45 in the dishpan]
This is the way we wash our gun... wash our gun... wash our gun...
Stop or my mom will shoot!
Stop! Stop that man, Joe. Stop that man!
[Joe tackles the man]
I saw that man on America's Most Wanted.
What did he do?
He killed his mother.

[to the flight attendants]
It was so cute, when he was 6 years old he walked into the kitchen and said "Mommy! My peepee's stuck in my zipper!"
Mom, I don't like eggs.
If you don't eat them now, they'll be waiting here for you at dinner.
Why didn't you answer when I called?
That was you? You never called.
That was me, why didn't you pick up the phone?
Every year when I'm about to come out to visit, you call and say it's not a good time, so I decided not to answer the phone this time in case you called.
Mom, what're you doing here?
I've got to change you.

[looks down and realizes he's wearing a diaper]
Mommy! I don't want to be changed.

[holding up diapers and baby powder]
I've got to change you.
